project_description: A simple Flutter application that displays a text (Cat with clock icon) and switches it to Dog (with person icon) on click.
architecture_overview: The project follows a modular architecture with clean separation of concerns. State management is handled using the Cubit pattern.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
participant AnimalScreen
participant AnimalCubit
User -> AnimalScreen : Tap on text
AnimalScreen -> AnimalCubit : toggleAnimal()
AnimalCubit -> AnimalCubit : _toggleState()
AnimalCubit --> AnimalScreen : stateChanged
AnimalScreen --> User : Update UI
@enduml
state_management_flow: The state is managed using Cubit. The AnimalCubit manages the current state of the animal text. The state can be toggled between Cat and Dog by calling the toggleAnimal method. The UI listens to state changes using BlocBuilder and updates accordingly.
navigation_flow: The app has a single screen (AnimalScreen) that displays the current animal text. The navigation structure is simple, with no additional screens or routes.
